title: SPEED: Streaming Partition and Parallel Acceleration for Temporal Interaction Graph Embedding. (arXiv:2308.14129v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: Temporal Interaction Graphs (TIGs) are widely employed to model intricate real-world systems such as financial systems and social networks. To capture the dynamism and interdependencies of nodes, existing TIG embedding models need to process edges sequentially and chronologically. However, this requirement prevents it from being processed in parallel and struggle to accommodate burgeoning data volumes to GPU. Consequently, many large-scale temporal interaction graphs are confined to CPU processing. Furthermore, a generalized GPU scaling and acceleration approach remains unavailable. To facilitate large-scale TIGs' implementation on GPUs for acceleration, we introduce a novel training approach namely Streaming Edge Partitioning and Parallel Acceleration for Temporal Interaction Graph Embedding (SPEED). translated_title: SPEED: 基于流式划分和并行加速的时间交互图嵌入
translated_abstract: 时间交互图(TIGs)被广泛应用于建模复杂的现实世界系统，如金融系统和社交网络。为了捕捉节点的动态性和相互依赖关系，现有的TIG嵌入模型需要按照顺序和时间顺序处理边。然而，这种要求阻止了并行处理，并且难以适应不断增长的数据量到GPU上。因此，许多大规模时间交互图被限制在CPU上处理。此外，目前还没有一种通用的GPU扩展和加速方法。为了实现在GPU上加速大规模TIG的实施，我们提出了一种新的训练方法，即基于流式边划分和并行加速的时间交互图嵌入(SPEED)。SPEED由流式边划分组件(SEP)和并行加速组件(PAC)组成，SEP通过将较少的节点分配给每个GPU来解决空间开销问题，而PAC则实现并行加速。
tldr: SPEED是一个新的训练方法，通过流式边划分和并行加速方式，在GPU上实现了大规模时间交互图的嵌入加速。
en_tdlr: SPEED is a novel training approach that achieves embedding acceleration for large-scale temporal interaction graphs on GPU, through a streaming edge partitioning and parallel acceleration mechanism.
